sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Good morning Europe. It's Friday the 22nd of April. Thanks for joining us. These are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia rejects Ukraine's offer to establish an Easter truce and Zelensky calls for international aid of 6.5 billion euros a month to keep the country's economy alive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson heads to India to negotiate a post-Brexit trade deal,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: just as MPs give the go-ahead for an inquiry into whether he misled Parliament over the Partygate scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And the number of Serbians in favour of joining the EU is lower than those against.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This, as the European Parliament says it regrets Serbia not following EU sanctions on Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: There's no respite for Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: After almost two months of invasion, Russia claims that the entire territory is under their control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Moscow has released this video claiming that the entire territory has been conquered but it is impossible to verify where it was filmed but the u.s insists that ukrainian forces still control as of stal meanwhile president zelensky reported in his nightly address that the kremlin has not agreed to his proposal of a ceasefire in the east of the country unfortunately russia rejected the offer to establish an easter truce this very well demonstrates how the leaders of this state actually relate to the christian faith to one of the most joyful and important holidays but we hope hope for peace hope that life will conquer death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, Zelensky also called for international aid, asking for 6.1 billion euros a month to keep the country's economy alive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the east, Russian advances are progressing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Kiev has confirmed that thousands of localities in the east have fallen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: On the northern front, Kharkiv continues to suffer from Russian artillery selling. At least two people were killed and five wounded after several selling in the eastern part of the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine has confirmed that Russia controls most of the strategic port city of Mariupol, but Ukrainian forces remain there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Earlier, the Russian president ordered his troops not to risk more losses by storming the besieged city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Putin instead called for Russian troops to blockade the Azov-Astal steelworks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The mayor of Mariupol scoffed at the idea that a Russian victory was already achieved. The city was, is and remains Ukrainian today. Because today our brave warriors, our heroes are defending our city as much as possible. So it doesn't matter what statements are made there. The city is and will be Ukrainian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: statements are made there, the city is and will be Ukrainian." Mariupol has been a key objective for Russia since the start of the invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Capturing the city would allow Moscow to establish a land corridor to Ukraine's Crimean Peninsula that Russia annexed in 2014 and deprive Ukraine of a major port and prized industrial assets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The operation continues according to plan. Mariupol, which has become a hub of nationalist formations, has been liberated. There was and still is an opportunity for Ukrainian troops to lay down their arms and come out via established corridors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, three school buses filled with evacuees from Mariupol arrived in Zaporizhzhia after crossing through territory held by Russian forces. Women and children finally arrived after attempts to open a humanitarian corridor from Mariupol had been delayed multiple times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: had been delayed multiple times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia has added 29 US citizens to its blacklist of sanctioned people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The group of politicians, businessmen and journalists are now banned from entering Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It includes the US Vice President Kamala Harris, Pentagon spokesperson John Kirby, Meta founder Mark Zuckerberg, as well as the chief executives of Bank of America and LinkedIn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But that is not the story on the front pages in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Most of the pro-Kremlin press is focusing on the meeting between President Putin and Russia's defense minister, where Putin congratulated the army for its successful operation to capture Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, the US State Department says Ukrainian forces are still holding ground in the city and calls Russia's claims disinformation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Galina Pavlonskaya, Euronews from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez condemned the atrocities allegedly committed by Russian forces in the town of Borodynaka outside Kyiv during a visit to Ukraine with his Danish counterpart.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Sanchez and Mete Friedriksson arrived in Kiev earlier on Thursday for talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Both premiers promised him military support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's clear that one of the most important messages from Denmark today is that we expect to deliver even more weapons to Ukraine, because that's what's needed most.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A ship of the Spanish Navy, the Isabel, sailed off today from a Spanish port bound for Poland, loaded with 200 tons of modern ammunition and all the material.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The ship carries 30 trucks, several special heavy transport vehicles, and 10 smaller vehicles loaded with the military material that will be transferred to Ukraine." Meanwhile US President Joe Biden made his own donation of multi-million euros worth of weapons and ammunition to Ukraine in the coming days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: President Biden said, Today, I'm announcing another $800 million to further augment Ukraine's ability to fight in the east, in the Donbass region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This package includes heavy artillery weapons, dozens of howitzers, and 144,000 rounds of ammunition to go with those howitzers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It also includes more tactical drones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Despite calls for help, hundreds of tanks remain stored up in Flensburg in Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Despite calls for help, hundreds of tanks remain stored up in Flensburg in Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Chancellor Scholz is facing more and more criticism for hesitating amid pressure to deliver heavy armour to Ukraine, just like other NATO members have already done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Boris Johnson is away from the heat of Partygate in Westminster today. Instead, he's in the heat of New Delhi, meeting his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi, eager to advance a post-Brexit trade deal with the world's sixth largest and fastest growing major economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: To put into context just how keen, this visit was delayed from last year because then India was the epicentre of the Delta variant of Covid. At the time, Johnson was accused of delaying a ban on travellers from India in case any offence would scupper a trade deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Well, now he says he believes a trade deal can be done by the autumn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But will Johnson risk offending Modi today by raising India's failure to condemn Russia over its invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And as trade experts point out, a deal with India would be a significant prize, but extremely difficult to achieve.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It has a reputation as one of the most protectionist economies in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And although Johnson is 6,000 kilometres from London, domestic political issues follow him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The British journalists with him keep asking whether he'll resign over those parties he attended in his Downing Street home and office, while ordinary Britons were staying apart because of Covid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Parliament yesterday decided to investigate whether he lied to MPs when he repeatedly insisted that no rules were broken, and more of Johnson's Conservative MPs called on him to quit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Even if his trade mission achieves little, sometimes it's nice just to get away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ty Ghenwright, Euronews, in London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The 59th edition of the Viennese Biennale, one of the most prestigious art events in the world, will begin on April 23rd.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: 89 pavilions representing different countries are showcased in the so-called Olympics of the art world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Aside from the national pavilions, a large central exhibition is organized by an invited curator. This year Cecilia Alemani, the first female Italian curator, decided to bring women, non-binary and trans artists to the centre of the conversation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In the last 125 years in 57 editions there has been a great preponderance of male artists, so I wanted to fix it a little bit. quindi ho voluto un po' riaggiustare la storia. Visitors can see the exhibited works until November 27th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This is Good Morning Europe. We'll have plenty more after the break.
